purpose.summary: This JCL procedure compiles CICS-enabled COBOL programs using IGYCRCTL, replicates the compiler listing to SYSOUT, copies the CICS entry linkage module DFHEILID, and link-edits the object into a load module using HEWL. It is designed for building CICS programs after related BMS compilation. Parameters allow customization of memory, high-level qualifiers, libraries, source, and output datasets.
purpose.business_context: Supports the build process for CICS COBOL applications, such as the CARDDEMO sample

inputs.name: SOURCE
inputs.description: COBOL source code member specified by &MEM in dataset &HLQ..CARDDEMO.CBL

inputs.name: CPYBKS
inputs.description: Copybook library &HLQ..CARDDEMO.CPY for SYSLIB during compilation

inputs.name: MEM
inputs.description: Member name for source, listing, and load module

inputs.name: HLQ
inputs.description: High-level qualifier for datasets like source, copybooks, loadlib, listing

inputs.name: COBLIB
inputs.description: COBOL compiler library IGY.SIGYCOMP.V63 for STEPLIB

inputs.name: DFHLOAD
inputs.description: CICS load library for STEPLIB and SYSLIB

outputs.name: LOADLIB
outputs.description: Load library &HLQ..CARDDEMO.LOADLIB receiving the linked module &MEM

business_rules.description: Compile COBOL with CICS translator, no dynamic calls, reentrant code, no sequence numbers
Link-edit with AMODE(31), RMODE(ANY), including LIST,XREF,LET,MAP options

paragraphs.purpose: COBOL program compile step using IGYCRCTL
Replicate compiler listing to SYSOUT using IEBGENER
Copy CICS DFHEILID module to temporary dataset using IEBGENER
Link-edit step using HEWL to produce load module

open_questions.question: Specific usage of CARDDEMO datasets
open_questions.context: Dataset names like CARDDEMO.CBL, CARDDEMO.CPY suggest a sample application, but exact business purpose not detailed in PROC
open_questions.suggestion: Review calling JCL or CARDDEMO source for context

open_questions.question: Custom environment adjustments
open_questions.context: Comments note to check with Administrator for JCL suitable to environment (line 22)
